meanings.definition: To bring food back up from the stomach to the mouth.
meanings.sent1: After eating too quickly, he had to regurgitate his meal.
meanings.sent2: The bird regurgitated a fish for its chicks.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to regurgitate its breakfast as a gift for its owner.
meanings.sent4: The volcano seemed to regurgitate fire and ash.
meanings.sent5: The magician regurgitated a whole deck of cards during the show.

meanings.definition: To repeat information without analyzing or understanding it.
meanings.sent1: During the exam, he had to regurgitate facts he barely remembered.
meanings.sent2: Students often regurgitate memorized answers without truly learning the material.
meanings.sent3: The robot could only regurgitate the data it was programmed with.
meanings.sent4: The news anchor seemed to regurgitate the same stories every evening.
meanings.sent5: Her speech felt like she would regurgitate the same points over and over again.

meanings.definition: To give back or return something.
meanings.sent1: She promised to regurgitate the borrowed book as soon as she finished.
meanings.sent2: The store allowed customers to regurgitate items within 30 days for a refund.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to regurgitate the stolen slipper but got caught in the act.
meanings.sent4: The river regurgitated the lost treasure after the storm.
meanings.sent5: He had to regurgitate the incorrect change he gave to the customer.
